importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date of the news report, indicating when the public was informed of Doug Martin’s death following a police encounter.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The incident occurred early Saturday, and the public learned of it on Monday, October 20, 2025, highlighting the timeline of events and the delay in public disclosure.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police during a detention related to a break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin, known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, was 36 years old at the time of his death and had a distinguished NFL career including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
The Oakland Police Department reported a 'brief struggle' during the arrest, but did not provide further details.
An autopsy has not been completed yet, and the official cause of death remains undisclosed.
Martin was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL Draft and finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
He was named one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history during their 50th anniversary celebration.
The Buccaneers and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, emphasizing Martin's legacy and impact.
Martin’s family requested privacy during their time of grief.
The incident has sparked public concern over police conduct and the safety of individuals during detentions, especially those with a criminal history or public profile.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland Police Department officers during a detention related to a suspected break-in at a home in Oakland. The incident occurred early Saturday, and Martin was transported to a hospital where he passed away at age 36. The exact cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending. The Oakland Police Department stated there was a brief struggle, but did not provide further details. Martin, selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft, was a Pro Bowl and All-Pro selection and recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history. The team and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences. The family requested privacy during their grieving process. The incident has raised broader concerns about police conduct, especially during detentions involving individuals with public profiles or criminal history.
title: Former NFL player Doug Martin dies after struggle with police during detention
